me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.datastore

Interface MessageProvider


  • public interface MessageProvider
    A provider of user-friendly color-formatted messages. To access a message provided by a MessageProvider, it is recommended that you use the static methods present on the Message class.
    Author:
    Glen Husman

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Message getMessage(java.lang.String messageId)
      Gets the message with the specified message ID.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getProvidedMessages()
      Gets the set of provided messages.
      boolean isReadOnly()
      Determines the read/write status of this message provider.
      void saveMessages()
      Saves all messages stored by this provider to the backend, if applicable.
      void setMessage(Message value)
      Adds a message to this provider.
      void setMessage(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
      Adds a message to this provider.

    • Method Detail

      • getMessage

        Message getMessage(java.lang.String messageId)
        Gets the message with the specified message ID.
        Returns:
        The message with the specified ID, or null if it is not provided by this MessageProvider.

      • getProvidedMessages

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getProvidedMessages()
        Gets the set of provided messages. This is a collection of keys, not values.
        Returns:
        A Set of keys of messages provided by this MessageProvider.

      • isReadOnly

        boolean isReadOnly()
        Determines the read/write status of this message provider.
        Returns:
        If this is a read-only message provider.

      • saveMessages

        void saveMessages()
        Saves all messages stored by this provider to the backend, if applicable.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if this is a read-only message provider.

      • setMessage

        void setMessage(Message value)
                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Adds a message to this provider.
        Parameters:
        value - The Message instance to set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if this is a read-only message provider.

      • setMessage

        void setMessage(java.lang.String key,
              java.lang.String value)
                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Adds a message to this provider.
        Parameters:
        key - The identifying key of the message.
        value - The value of the message, which will have color codes preceded with the ampersand character translated appropriately.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if this is a read-only message provider.
